verses.roman:
śuni' tāṅra mātā pitā duḥkhita ha-ila
putra-ṭhāñi dravya-manuṣya pāṭhāite mana kaila

synonyms: śuni'-hearing; tāṅra—his; mātā pitā—father and mother; duḥkhita ha-ila—became very unhappy; putra-ṭhāñi—to their son; dravya-manuṣya—articles and men; pāṭhāite—to send; mana kaila—decided.
translation: Hearing the description of Raghunātha dāsa's behavior in the renounced order, his father and mother were very unhappy. Therefore they decided to send him some men with goods for his comfort.
